Manage your UCLA Logon ID

You can review your account and manage its security settings.

UCLA Logon ID:
jbruin
More Info

A UCLA Logon ID is UCLAâ€™s user account for web single sign-on, campus VPN, wireless network, and library computer lab workstations. Students can set an alias to change what is displayed as their UCLA Logon ID once. You can manage aspects of this account below.

Security

UCLA Logon Password:
Set
Change Password

Your new password must be different from the old password, between 8 and 128 characters long, is case-sensitive, and must use at least one character from two of the three sets of allowed characters:

  • letters: a-z or A-Z
  • numbers: 0-9
  • special characters: !@#$%^&*().,
Your passwords don't match and/or this doesn't follow the rules above!
Challenge Phrase:
None Set
Set Phrase

A Challenge Phrase allows you reset your password online. Both the challenge and response must be between 8 and 128 characters long. They cannot be the same, and the response is case-sensitive.

Multifactor Authentication:
Inactive
Activate in MFA Tool

(set, unset)
